بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم
هذا كتاب من هشام بن زياد عامل الأمير عبــد الملك بن يزيد على أعلى أشمون
ليحنّس ابن إسدور
من أهل دير أبو أبلّوا من أعلى أشمون إنّه أصابك من جزية رأسك لسنــة
ست وثلثين ومائة دينرين عددا فادفع ذلك إلى قبّل قريتك في
ستّة أطبل فأن يكتتب لك براه منها ختمها بخاتمــه ولا تدفع إليه
شيئا سوا ذلك الكمـ لإن وحــمى تكتبن أن خذ في قريتــك
بجزية بعثت أو غيره فإن أخذ عنك حقّا ر إليها فإن يكره
أن يكتبها لك ولا تدفعن إليه شيا وأتيني فإنّي غير كتبا
لك شيا ادّعته على أحد لم يأتيني منه خيرا وكتب يحي سلا

... paid (for) indiction
In the name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful.
This is a wri[ting] from Hishām son of Z[iyād] the executive [of the] amīr [ʿAb]d al-Malik b. Yazīd over [the Upper Ashmūn?]
to Yuḥannis b. Isidūr (vac.)
of the people of the monastery of Abū Abullū in Upper Ashmūn. He has assigned to you as your head-tax for the year
one hundred and thirty-six two dīnār[s in coin. So p]ay it [to] the collector of your village in
six instalments. And let him write [for you a receipt] for this, [sealing it?] with his seal and do [not] pa[y] to him
anything except this ...?. And if ... you should definitely write that he take [...] in your villa[ge]
with jizya, which you sent or someone else. And if he receives from you what he deserves [...] to it. [And if] he refuse[s]
to write it (the receipt) for you, then do not pay him anything but come to me and I, without ...
for you something else (than what) I claimed from someone who did not come to me from him in a good way. And Yaḥyā wrote it in
Jumādā II of the year one hundred and thirty-six.
By God.....Abū? Almūn The.na b. Ziyād, over the south
of Shmoun, the city, writes to Ioannnes son of Isidoros of the Monastery
of Apa Apollo. This is what has been assigned to you to pay
of your dia]g[raphon] over the canon of the 8th indiction, year 136 which is nomismata 2
(imp.)] and pay them in six instalments and pay them to the assistant of your village.
And take an entagion for them which he seals with his seal for a
...] it is for a man if he were to die or rather
...] your assistant wants to give an entagion for you. Come
to me (if he asks) you for more than the amount you see in
your entagion. So that you know, I have drawn up this order for payment for you.
